abstract.text: A panel that queries the user for information such as paper type and orientation.

inlineContent.text: A page layout panel is typically displayed in response to the user selecting the Page Setup menu item. You obtain an instance with the
class method. The pane can then be run as a sheet using

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A panel that queries the user for information such as paper type and orientation.
An array of accessory view controllers belonging to the page layout panel.
Returns the page layout panelâ€™s accessory view.
Adds the specified controller of an accessory view to be presented in the page setup panel.
Presents a page setup sheet for the specified print info object, document-modal relative to the specified window.
Returns a newly created page layout object.
The printing information object used when the page layout panel is run.
Sets the page layoutâ€™s values to those stored in the print info object used when the page layout panel is run.
Removes the specified controller of an accessory view.
Displays the page layout panel and begins the modal loop using the shared print info object.
Displays the page layout panel and begins the modal loop using the specified print info object.
Adds a view object to the page layout panel.
Writes the page layoutâ€™s values to the print info object used when the page layout panel is run.
An object that stores information thatâ€™s used to generate printed output.
The Print panel that queries the user for information about a print job.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
